definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)

sentences.english: I feel flattered by your invitation.
sentences.chinese: 受到你的邀请，我感到受宠若惊。

sentences.english: I didn't know whether to feel flattered or disgusted.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道是否感到受宠若惊或厌恶。

sentences.english: I didn no dat. I'm flattered, ty.
sentences.chinese: 我并不想那么做，我受宠若惊，谢谢你。

sentences.english: Crumb was the favored jester in the court of Jabba the Hutt.
sentences.chinese: 在赫特人贾巴的宫殿里，他是受宠的小丑。

sentences.english: When I was little, I didn't feel like I was the favorite.
sentences.chinese: 我很小的时候，并不觉得自己最受宠。

sentences.english: Silk is favorable tribute in feudalistic dynasty, as well as luxury goods in west countries.
sentences.chinese: 丝绸是封建朝廷的受宠贡品，更是风靡西方的奢侈品。

sentences.english: I mean, it's flattering, I guess, but couldn't you have done a little better?
sentences.chinese: 虽然我受宠若惊但你找不到更好的人选？

sentences.english: Bill is anxious to get in the boss's good books.
sentences.chinese: 比尔渴望在老板那里受宠。

sentences.english: How spoiled we get here. Makes very little difference.
sentences.chinese: 我们真是受宠若惊，不会有所不同。

sentences.english: But as far as doting wife goes, I think I lack form.
sentences.chinese: 但是作为一个受宠的妻子，我觉得我做得不够格。

sentences.english: Everyone treated me so well that I was humbled.
sentences.chinese: 大家对我都很好，我简直受宠若惊。
“什么，没有啊，”丈夫受宠若惊地说。

sentences.english: But some experts believe being less favoured can have positive consequences.
sentences.chinese: 不过一些专家认为，不受宠也会带来积极的影响。

sentences.english: At home, Tom is the white-haired boy.
sentences.chinese: 在家中，汤姆是最受宠的人。

sentences.english: It takes time to build the political will to go after a beloved company.
sentences.chinese: 培养追捕一家受宠的公司的政治意愿需要时间。

sentences.english: He said he was flattered to hear about the talk in Las Vegas.
sentences.chinese: 他说他为那些发生在拉斯维加斯的谈话感到受宠若惊。

definition: (old) (esp. of the Emperor) to show special favor towards
special favor from a ruler/Emperor's generosity towards a favorite
to favor a junior/to show favoritism to some juniors
